alert.note: Alert for Sweet Grass (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 13 at 3:45AM MDT until June 14 at 6:03PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Billings MT has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Montana... Boulder River at Big Timber affecting Sweet Grass County. .Combination of rainfall and melting snow is expected to push the Boulder River above flood stage. How far above flood stage the Boulder River will rise is hard to determine due to uncertainties with the rain falling on the snow in the high country. As a result the forecast crest should be used as a starting point and not a definite peak. If you live or are recreating along the river be prepared for flooding. Additional updates to the river forecast and warning will be updated as more information becomes available. For the Boulder River...including Big Timber...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW EVENING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Boulder River at Big Timber. * WHEN...From early this morning to tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 7.5 feet, Minor flooding along the south bank. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 AM MDT Monday the stage was 7.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this afternoon to 8.1 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.0 feet on 06/30/2011. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 am) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Boulder River Big Timber 8.0 7.5 Mon 2 am 8.0 6.2 5.4 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. To escape rising water, take the shortest path to higher ground. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: https://water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 515 PM MDT.
